A4.text: Portuguese is the official and national language of Brazil, being widely spoken by nearly all of its population.

A5.text: aside from Portuguese, the country also has numerous minority languages, including... languages of more recent European and Asian immigrants, such as Italian, German and Japanese.

A6.text: the standard variant of Portuguese, known as norma culta, is used in formal contexts across Brazil
